bibl.title: Economic Rationalism and Rural Society in Third-Century A.D. Egypt. The Heroninos Archive and the Appianus Estate. (Cambridge Classical Studies.)
bibl.note: Reconstructs the life and workings of the Appianus estate in the Fayum (IIIrd c. A.D.). - Pp. 410-420: Index of all the published texts of the Heroninos archive. - Pp. 456-462: réédition de P. Wessely Pragenses sans No. d'Inv. + P. Vindob. Graec. Inv. 32010 (= S.B. VI, 9409, 2; XIV, 12382 recto).
bibl.seg: 145.4 P. Wessely Pragenses sans No. d'Inv. + P. Vindob. Graec. Inv. 32010
RATHBONE Dominic, Economic Rationalism and Rural Society in Third-Century A.D. Egypt. The Heroninos Archive and the Appianus Estate. (Cambridge Classical Studies.)
Cambridge, University Press, 1991, 8°, xix-489 pp., 1 carte, tabl. £45/$84.50.

Reconstructs the life and workings of the Appianus estate in the Fayum (IIIrd c. A.D.). - Pp. 410-420: Index of all the published texts of the Heroninos archive. - Pp. 456-462: réédition de P. Wessely Pragenses sans No. d'Inv. + P. Vindob. Graec. Inv. 32010 (= S.B. VI, 9409, 2; XIV, 12382 recto).

C.R. par Roger S. Bagnall, JRS 83 (1993) pp. 254-256. - Jean Bingen, ChrEg 70 (1995) Nos 139-140, pp. 323-327. - Andrea Jördens, BibO 52 (1995) coll. 410-419. - Dennis P. Kehoe, JRA 6 (1993) pp. 476-484. - Mandell, AncW 23 (1992) pp. 97-99. - Ausilia Saija, APapyrol 3 (1991) pp. 156-157. - Reinhold Scholl, HZ 259 (1994) pp. 165-166. - Jean A. Straus, AntCl 62 (1993) pp. 445-446. - Wiedemann, G&R 39 (1992) pp. 239-240. - Greg Woolf, CR N.S., 43 (1993) pp. 351-352. - Jean Lenaerts, Latomus 59 (2000) pp. 486-487. - Jean Andreau et Jérôme Maucourant, Topoi 9 (1999) pp. 47-102.
